One of the more meaningful keys, therefore, to
successful experience here is the degree of in¬
volvement it is possible to achieve. With radio
transmission also, we are supporting the idea of
using known "frames of reference" in the development
of our programming materials and formats. In
mentioning "frames of reference" we should also
say a word about language at this juncture. What
it is most important to keep in mind is that we do
not have any visual image to depend upon for rein¬
forcement. People who have the responsibility for
program development, as well as support materials
personnel (software) should be aware of the sig¬
nificance of language structures in program planning.
Taking the age groupings mentioned earlier, the pro¬
gramming spectrum could be developed along the
following lines, including both innovation (new pro¬
gram formats) and extant program materials.
